Overall%20Experience.Review: I really love everything about Saint Louis University  and i hope i see a better life and experience
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
What I Liked: I really enjoyed the opportunity to work on complex, hands-on projects that allowed me to apply my knowledge in real-world situations. The exposure to different teams and the mentorship I received helped me grow both personally and professionally. I also appreciated the inclusive culture that promoted open communication and collaboration. Being part of such a dynamic and supportive environment allowed me to develop new skills and broaden my perspective.

What I'd Like to See Change: While I had an overall positive experience, I would have loved to see more structured feedback throughout the internship or program. Having regular check-ins or constructive feedback would help guide my development and ensure I'm on the right track. Additionally, more networking opportunities with senior leaders or people outside of my immediate team would be beneficial for a well-rounded experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a beautiful school with wonderful professors who know their subject and care about the development of the students that attend their classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is a great school with an amazing vibe, the campus is beautiful and the academics are diverse and robust. The humanities has some of the best researchers for their fields and incredible classes for any interest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St. Louis is an incredible place to learn and grow. Academics are tough, but professors genuinely care and are accessible. Collaboration is encouraged, making even the hardest classes manageable. The campus is beautiful, and Forest Park next door is a huge plus. Social life depends on how much you put yourself out there—there are tons of clubs, student events, and a mix of Greek life and non-Greek activities. Dorms are nice, and while the food is decent, it could be better. The workload is intense, but support is available through tutoring, office hours, and wellness programs. The WashU bubble is real, but St. Louis has great places to explore if you make the effort. The student body is diverse but leans wealthy, which can sometimes be noticeable. Overall, WashU is a rigorous but rewarding place, and if you find balance between academics and social life, it can be an amazing experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great opportunities available to students no matter what industry you plan to join. Activities and fun outside of academics takes a little more effort to find.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is one of the best graduate school in the USA.  A university that not only nurtures global leaders but offers the best programs to students all over the world complemented by Experiential Learning.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Pros: Campus is beautiful. Dorms are second to none. Financial aid and merit scholarship opportunities are lightyears ahead of peer schools and many ivy league universities, great food options from locally owned spots, safe "bubble," easy access to public transit.

Cons: School spirit is disconnected/lacking, dining prices are gouged, difficult to navigate disability accommodations, can get sketchy in some areas off campus.

Overall WashU is a great place to go to school, and you'll find yourself enjoying it plenty as long as you know where to look.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Beautiful campus, academically competitive but peers are willing to cooperate. Housing is expensive but very nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: In my three semesters in WashU, I can say that my experience has definitely been life-changing. I have come to love the people and the community that makes up my school because of its rich diversity and welcome representation from various countries all over the world. My school also boasts of the best housing accommodations, as well as one of the top food and dining facilities across the country. Not to mention the world-class recreational amenities and libraries that are open and accessible to students even during the wee hours of the morning which has helped me tremendously during finals season. Known for its academically-rigorous curriculum, WashU has allowed me realize my intellectual potential, and push me to be better. Although my school has a good mental health program in place, having a more active and relatable initiative would probably benefit the students given its highly competitive and motivated environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The school and people are great. I came into the semester excited for the food, but I feel misled. The food quality is generally good as college food goes, but it varies.
The real issues are:

- The dining hall hours are restricted
- You don't get to serve yourself: 
              - no power over your portion size
             - don't get to pick and choose from different food stations without paying extra
- The meal points system make food (especially healthy) VERY expensive
- I could only transfer points once from a friend at a discount

They have started a buffet  pilot program in BD, which is better, but this is only one dining hall M-F for dinner (this is also worse quality). 

I had the platinum plan this fall and had to get thousands more meal points after I ran out in mid- October, even though I tried to eat the cheapest and healthiest food I can find. 

No one seems to want to take responsibility for this problem. I received 250 extra points via the food security fund.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Overall great school, but in 2024 the food deserves a D or an F. The school requires freshmen live on campus and buy a pretty expensive meal plan, so there is no excuse for it not being its worth. The meal plan is not 1:1 USD to meal points (so each meal point costs about $1.10) and yet the food is absurdly expensive AND low quality. Low quality food is annoying, but understandable if it is cheap. Expensive food is annoying, but understandable if it is high-quality. The main cafeteria's cheeseburger costs 12 meal points (~15usd) and is significantly lower quality than the sub-$7 McDonalds quarter pounder. 

WashU will not fix this situation until its rankings suffer because of it. Other than this one issue, WashU is an outstanding school, but in this category, it completely fails.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a member of the WashU varsity soccer team, I had a wonderful community of fellow athletes and supportive staff. I enjoyed the rigor of my academics and finding balance with a healthy social life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Washington University in St. Louis has been overwhelmingly positive. The diversity and support on campus have made my transition as an international student smooth and welcoming. I’ve found the academic rigor and resources, especially in the law school, to be outstanding. If there’s one area I’d love to see enhanced, it would be increased support for international students seeking on-campus internships and career guidance within the U.S. legal landscape. This would further enrich the university experience and help us better integrate into our fields of interest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I remember being so excited about my courses when I first came to WashU and they are indeed amazing. The professors are all SO easily approachable but I underestimated the workload. It's a crazy heavy workload compared to high school but very very rewarding indeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics here are difficult but the rate and depth at which you learn things is very impressive. The financial aid is great but you have to live with people who make 10x your family's income.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is truly a wonderful school, and is great for challenging yourself. Plenty of amazing programs that span across many majors. My only concern is the price, especially coming from a middle class family. My mom makes 85K a year, and my dad 70K, however, they are divorced, with two separate houses and lives. Neither one supports me. But because they make that much money, my tuition charge is 20% of their combined income in a year. Plus, the food isn't that good for how much we have to pay in meal plans.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
What I liked
- very engaged campus community 
- opportunity to connect with faculty 
- lots of active extracurriculars
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU made a life I never thought possible through their generous financial aid policy, and I'm so happy to call myself a student here. I have had a fantastic experience as an architecture student, and have been connected with a plethora of internship opportunities through professors and scholarships alike. The sheer number of resources available to each student are so overwhelming it makes it difficult to choose where you should apply for funding for a project. I am so happy to be here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a mixed experience at WashU.  Academically, the university is very strong, but this is expected.  I found the student life, athletics, extracurriculars, etc..., basically everything EXCEPT academics, to be lacking.  There's more to a great university than pretty buildings and chasing rankings, and those things are obvious priorities at WashU.  If rankings, pretty buildings, and a purely academic experience speak to you, you may really like it here.  I found it somewhat isolating.  St. Louis is a struggling city, but the area around WashU is actually pretty nice.  There are good off-campus activities and diversions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall a fantastic school. Very mild party scene if you aren’t connected to frats, but many clubs/athletics throw occasionally. Professors are usually amazing, and the dorms are very nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the ability to engage with my professors one on one. The students here are incredibly kind, smart, and collaborative making the community feel like a family.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It isn't perfect, but it is good and they are trying to improve. Just this year, students complained about hours at the dining hall, and less than two weeks in, WashU has extended them. That said, the college is super expensive, and they can't be trusted not to suddenly increase your tuition a LOT between years (my tuiton is three times what it was myfirst year).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a great experience attending WashU! It’s a wonderful place to be especially for undergraduates who crave a sense of community - I really enjoyed the campus atmosphere and the school’s housing was especially accommodating. I also liked the learning environment and was able to foster my educational growth, even amidst the pandemic.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I come from a very town with mostly latinos and african americans. WashU is mostly white and asian though which made me feel far from home. It took me a while to find latinos like me. The food is really good except there aren't many options so you inevitably get tired of it eventually. Courses and professors are great, have yet to meet a mean professor, they all clearly care about their students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had an excellent experience overall during my time at WashU. Most of my professors were great educators and researchers (particularly in my major path) and encouraged successful learning over good grades, as well as being accessible outside of normal class time to help with content questions. The opportunities for personal and professional growth at WashU are boundless (clubs, professional organizations, research, etc) and it's impossible to take advantage of them all in just four years. I would be excited to see the school work on making tuition more affordable and diversifying its student body.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far I am happy with my school and my expectations were met over and beyond, I am particularly impressed by the diversity within the schools enrolment. There is a beautiful blend of about 29 nationalities in my class.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St. Louis is a diverse, bustling institution with rigorous course work, an active student body, and a beautiful campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm glad I went to WashU for my undergraduate education. Academically, it was tough, particularly for STEM majors. Many of the intro science courses were difficult and needed to be graded on a curve (we called them "weed-out" classes because they weeded out pre-med students who weren't serious about their grades). However, student life was wonderful and there were so many activities, opportunities, and resources on campus. The student housing and food options were all fantastic. St. Louis is the perfect backdrop for an undergraduate experience - still a city, but approachable and infused with personality. I met many of my life-long friends here!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St. Louis is overall a great school. There are lots of networking and research opportunities and ways to get involved at school and in the community. I would like to see an improvement in the social life aspect as Greek Life is seen very negatively and clubs can be very selective.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience with Washington University in St. Louis has been adventurous so far. I have gotten the amazing opportunity to work with brilliant students and professors from across the world. The diverse nature and vivid scenery of the campus never fails to captivate my attention and appreciation for my university. I am constantly being challenged and pushed to become a better student, intern, and overall person which is exactly what I look for in a college. GO BEARS!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Definitely improve the overall diversity on campus. I would not recommend this school for athletes because there is little athletics here and it is not the primary focus. Academics ere are exceptional but you definitely would have to work hard to excel in courses.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a rising sophomore I enjoyed my first year at washu. The professors are excellent, kind, and easy to access with many office hours. Social life is mid tho.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved WashU- the campus is beautiful, students are very smart and nice, but it is not a competitive environment. It is not a huge party school but there are opportunities if that is what you are looking for. Great dorms and food.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great first year here at WashU. Very nice students and professors who help make the experience enjoyable. It is tough academically so be ready to grind. Overall though chill vibes and look forward to my next 3 years here at WashU
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Good career placement! Good career placement! Good career placement! Good career placement! Good career placement!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoy being a student at Washington Universtiy. This university gives me an irreplaceable and refreshing feeling. I have learned so much about myself as a person and student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I am a sophomore at WashU. The depth of the education and the number of opportunities (if you seek them) can be life-changing. The business school is super good at hosting recruitment events if your interested in business careers, and the academics ARE HARD -- You will do a lot of work. CS department could be stronger; premed/ bio/chem/pre-law deps / olin are excellent. 
The undergraduate student body is tight-knit and mostly extremely friendly. People are very smart but not obnoxious or entitled. Campus life is great because many of the undergrads (freshmen, sophomores, and some juniors) live on campus. The housing is excellent, and many students have kitchens on campus. St Louis is certainly not a luxury city (i.e. NY or LA) but does have good restaurants (DRIVE NOT WALK AWAY) and a cheap cost of living (concerts are usually way cheaper). It is way better than being in the woods, but not the bestest place. The school has partially impeded on the fun with their attack on greek life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The Washu student experience is designed with a specific type of student in mind. If you enjoy rigorous academics and great career building opportunities, you might find success here. If you enjoy going out, partying  or exploring, do not come here. Almost everyone on campus knows of someone who was robbed, carjacked, or even killed. In addition the area surrounding Washu lacks places to go. A lot of people here can relate to feeling physically, and mentally "trapped" at Washu. On campus there is a culture of conformity that is suffocating if you have opinions or even habits that don't align with others. Most conversations revolve around classes and those who enjoy other activities have found clubs and greek life. However, in recent years the school has been cutting funding for clubs and removing greek life. Everyone knows that historically Washu has been a great place to get an education. People don't know that the current state of Washu is drastically different from its reputation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved WashU and everything about it! As a covid freshman, I had the opportunity to see WashU grow and change as the pandemic progressed. I saw the good and the bad of WashU and stayed through both. There was a learning curve to this education journey, but throughout the path I met lifelong friends, forged deep and meaningful connections, and better understand the future that lies ahead.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love WashU. The weather is glorious. The students are so collaborative and friendly. Everyone works really hard but is also very kind. The academics are hard, but the advising system is so helpful! WashU is amazing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a freshman, I have so far loved my experience at WashU. The student body is very nice and welcoming. All of my classes are enjoyable and teachers make an effort to be accessible and understanding with students. WashU has so many resources, such as the career center, writing center, tutoring centers like the math help room et cetera, so you always know where to get help when feeling overwhelmed. Even though we don't have much sports culture, there is still a student body culture and school pride-- this is shown through things like our convocation, where all of the incoming freshman dress up in the colors of their residential college and celebrate starting the school year. WashU also promotes collaboration, such as study groups and extracurriculars, much more than most schools making it easy to find friends. In general, most people I know are happy at WashU, and I'm super glad I decided to come here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors overall are engaged, available, and care about their students. Campus food services are not always the best (in terms of cafeteria food, the quality isn't bad. But there's not a ton of variety in the main dining halls, and restaurants close pretty early. Most of the food locations aren't open on weekends either.) People on campus have always been helpful and inviting. Classmates are supportive in terms of forming study groups and sharing notes if you need help. There are resources for students (similar to many other universities) like a writing center, academic advising, and peer mentoring. They advertise a ton of different student groups to get involved in, and there really is something for everyone, and the people are really inviting. But some of the groups can be really competitive!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am thrilled with my experience at this school. It's refreshing to see that the school prioritizes creating well-rounded students. By encouraging students to focus on both their academics and extracurriculars, clubs, and mental/physical health, the school is setting them up for success in all areas of their lives. neglecting their extracurriculars, clubs, and mental/physical health.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's my third year here. Some of the happiest and most growthful years of my life. It's hard to learn how to study, how to find good friends, how to pursue and attain professional goals, and how to develop into a person you can be proud of. And once you learn these things it's hard to balance them all. This school has provided an environment to achieve all these things. So it's a good school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent academic community where professors truly make an effort to know every student no matter the class size or discipline.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU felt like home from the moment I stepped on campus all the way until I graduated. The campus, dorms and food was all world class that made the college experience amazing. The academics were challenging but rewarding.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is very well known for providing opportunities in such fields as medicine, research, and engineering. The students are very engaged in their intellectual pursuits and in every aspect of academic life; campus life is a big part of the student experience, too. There are many organizations, including student sports and arts groups. Wustl has a strong focus on medicine and healthcare with strengths in Bio Engineering and Healthcare Management. I am grateful for my undergraduate experience at Washington University in St. Louis and thankful for my very studious and reliable college roommates.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall the university is amazing. The professors are great and the campus is beautiful. The food is pretty good and there are plenty of different places to study. It may be difficult to find things to do outside of campus especially if you come from a big city, but the university itself has plenty of clubs and the gym facility is very nice to help pass the time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It’s just generally pleasant here. The people are nice and brilliant. The professors are great, no notes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school has great financial aid for undergraduate students. WashU is known for being highly ranked in its dorms and food, and it is clear that these are high quality when living on campus. The school has so many resources readily available to succeed both on and off campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is a place where the sky is the limit! You are given opportunities that will help you thrive in life during your college years and beyond. With such a tight knit community, Washington University in St. Louis is the perfect place to make your dreams a reality. At WashU you're not only going to get world class educatio, but you'll be leaving a better human being.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great. The people are very nice and the dorms/food options are great. Professors care about you, and love the classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are many opportunities around you and the people you will meet are all wanting to achieve something. The faculty are also great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the people I have met here, and it is a vibrant community to be a part of. St. Louis is a great place to go to school, and there is never a shortage of things to do. The transition from being top of my class in high school to a school full of people like me was very difficult, and I have struggled with my grades since my freshman year. While the programs may be hard, there are resources and tutors out there to take advantage of. WashU has a lot of academic support, but the biggest thing they are lacking in is mental health support. I have struggled more with mental health due to the stress of being here, and I know a lot of friends have struggled too. Other than more mental health support, I wouldn't change anything about WashU, and have had an otherwise positive experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think of the school highly overall. The opportunities it gives its students, the different degree and career paths a student could take, and the comradery between students is impressive . However, I do have problems with how the university treats its finances and keeping students up to date on changes to tuition.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU can be very tough academically, but I got to explore a variety of subject areas and left with so much experience outside of anything I thought I'd pursue. I was happy to see increased and ongoing investment in improving the socioeconomic diversity of the student body. You shouldn't come here if you're interested in a big party school with popular sports teams and big traditions, but I still found plenty of opportunities to have a thriving social life. I did find issues with school leadership, faculty, and professors, but overall my experience was definitely worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really love WashU. The campus is beautiful and the school is incredibly supportive. For instance, my career counselor went out of her way to help me find the internship I am currently doing. All the students are very studious and motivated, and there are large premed and finance/consulting cultures on campus, but it is not a cutthroat/competitive culture.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall I have had a great time at WashU. The student life experience is very good and the school definitely works to maintain that environment. The dorms and food are all much better than you would expect at college and most of the professors are good at teaching and are willing to help. There are also so many opportunities for undergraduate students to get involved professionally and extra-curricular wise. I like that WashU encourages their students to get as involved as possible to expand their connections and career possibilities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending WashU has got to be one of the biggest privileges of my life. Thanks to the university, I lived my life more in one year than I have ever before. I met amazing people and took amazing courses where I was pushed to work even harder than ever imagined. It wasn't easy at first leaving home and coming to an unknown place was really scary however, WashU made that transition fun and easy, and it made it feel like home extremely fast. I fell in love with campus culture the people and the environment WashU fostered, and I would vouch for it any day of the year. It's an amazing place with amazing opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washu is a highly welcoming school. Most professors effectively foster safe and open learning environments, and the student body has no competitive environment. Overall, Washu is a great college experience -- especially for those pursuing an interdisciplinary education.,
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University offers an inviting, collaborative community that is appealing to many.  This results in the wide diversity that WashU maintains.  This provides a great opportunity for students to experience other cultures besides their own.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing school. Great resources to ensure that each and every student succeeds to their potential. Never regret choosing this school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is a collaborative and great school environment. Everyone wants you to succeed and the faculty will do your best in order to help you achieve that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I feel like the environment at WashU was incredibly competitive and it fostered unhealthy habits both in myself and my peers. I disliked the food at WashU, especially the way that food options were incredibly limited on the main campus after a certain hour, literally after only 3 or 5 pm (which is SO early). It was incredibly inconvenient how the main dining hall's food options were closed on the weekends as well, it posed a barrier to any student who found themselves studying on campus during the weekend as there was a lack of food options. Some of my professors were not the best to say the least. I feel like WashU should definitely look at the people the hire better, especially the ones who teach the larger lecture courses. My bad experiences with professors in both my fall and spring semesters were solely for large lectures, my professors for the smaller classes were much better.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful, and all of the classes I've taken have been helpful to learning. The school is extremely competitive, and harsh toward students such as myself who came from less fortunate backgrounds. If you went to a smaller school that didn't offer as many higher-level classes, it will take more work to succeed, but it will absolutely be worth it. WashU offers many counselors and advisers to help students along the way, and there are tons of student support groups to help those students as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I found that all the upper-level classes that I have taken are really interesting and enjoyable. The worst part of classes are definitely getting through the introductory courses to take the more enjoyable upper-level classes. Life on campus is also fun, there are plenty of clubs or even events to go watch (there is always something to do whether that's watch a club that does comedy sketches with very SNL vibes on a Friday night each semester or watch your acapella friends compete). However, the administration is definitely controlled by those who lean right politically. They power washed away Trans Lives Matter and BLM protests, they had campus police follow a peaceful protest around fossil fuels, they did not protect a student who shared their political beliefs, and they allowed a transphobic, homophobic speaker on campus for the Republican club on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The community at Washington University in St. Louis supported me to grow as a student, friend, and a professional. The opportunities to explore my various interests in research, medicine, engineering, service, and social justice. Additionally, I loved being a member of the NCAA Championship-winning women's soccer team and being a part of a vibrant community of athletes. The passion, dedication, and determination I developed have prepared me to pursue a career in nursing. I wish, however, that the Pre-Health advising provided more opportunities to explore health career tracks outside of medical school. I believe I can make more of an impact as a researcher, leader, and teacher in nursing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've loved my time at WashU. The campus is gorgeous and they have great academic resources and amenities. The one thing I would like to see change is more one-on-one attention with academic advisors. The food could also be better.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am an incoming freshman in the fall and I am extremely excited to attend! I am a recruited soccer player and have already met the entire team and coaches; everyone is so nice and supportive, and I enjoyed touring the school field and brand new athletic facilities with them. WashU also has a very strong Jewish community which is very important to me, and I plan on being an active member of the hillel and chabbad on campus. Finally, I am excited to attend Olin Business School to study finance and continue my passion for complex problem solving in the business world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The city of St. Louis was strikingly serene thus, a perfect place to give 100% focus on academics as well as form a tight bond among the friends on campus. I wished that I had utilized more school facilities like laboratory equipment and further widen my research experience. 
I've heard that buildings are continuously renovated and newly built. I find these investments on facilities are good for the long-term, attracting competitive, ambitious students/professors. I respect the school's effort to accommodate many students from around the world as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy the diversity WashU offers. The academics, to be frank, are rigorous and my first year definitely consisted of a learning curve. However, the community here and resources this school offers is amazing. I have learned so so so much, and am looking forward to the next 3 years here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St. Louis is an amazing school with a beautiful campus. The university cares deeply about the student body and makes sure that everyone feels heard and included. The campus is stunning for all four seasons, and has plenty of areas to work outside or walk around. The campus is also very connected to the St. Louis community, and provides opportunities to study and work within the St. Louis area, as well as explore Forest Park and other tourist spots.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the campus, professors, and networking. It's a state of the art campus with great facilities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed some of my online classes that I took at WashU, I realize that every instructor as their own way of teaching. Some of my classes were good and then there were others that took more focus to complete. Overall it was an experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU provides exceptional opportunities for professional development right at your finger tips. Above all, however, it’s the people that make WashU what it is today.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed my experience at WashU and had the opportunity to study with excellent professors at the top of their field. I was challenged by the coursework and learned so much.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I will be starting Washington University in the Fall! From my tours I have fallen in love with the school and cannot wait to begin.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wash U has great academics and a beautiful campus, but it lacks in traditions and community/connectivity as a whole. This is likely due to the lack of good athletics and constant cancelling of student event and traditions by the administration.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Have great professor that are there and are willing to help you succeed. I am over 50 and I greatly appreciate that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had a very positive experience my freshman year and have been really appreciative of all the support systems in place for students here. I feel like the transition to college has been made much easier in this environment and really enjoy being a part of the WashU community. Though it may not be as well known as some other schools, it is definitely deserving of its reputation, with a great student body and community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved WashU. Everyone will tell you the people are amazing - from friends to professors to the cafeteria staff - and it's definitely true. The campus is beautiful and has a great location right next to Forest Park. Not to mention it is one of the best universities in the country, and while you'll get your fair share of "how's Seattle???" from family and friends, the people who need to know it definitely do.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Pre-Med course-load is intense but rewarding. You get out what you put in. And it definitely requires putting in a lot of effort and dedication. But, I'm still a first-year and the memories made are one-of-a-kind. All of my professors love what they do and they love seeing students succeed in challenging courses.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Even though I attended college during the pandemic, I really enjoyed going to WashU. It's a HARD school. You will spend a huge amount of your time studying, and a decent amount crying because of how hard the work is. If you read that and still want to go, this is the right school for you. WashU is one of the best schools in the country for pre-med and other graduate education. Equally important: the people are genuinely friendly, the professors will make time for you, and the quality-of life standards are higher than almost any other college offers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I could not ask for a better school. The students are spectacular, driven, and kind. The Faculty and Staff are always friendly and want to watch you succeed. I have never had a dull day at WashU. Yes, you can always find people studying in the library and other areas such as Bauer and Mckelvy, but there is also always something to do to let you take a break from the constant grind. I do not think I could have chosen a better school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: From my first week at WashU this past fall, I felt that WashU had the resources of a top-20 school, but maintained a community-based experience. I enjoy the freedom of my class schedule, especially in comparison to friends at other schools who have a far-higher mandated schedule for their Freshman year. I also love the Ampersand programs. My Ampersand, Global Citizenship Program, has been my favorite class throughout the year and I will be devastated when it's over next year! My class is traveling to Ecuador in the spring and I could not be more excited. The dedication to these programs is incredible and I am extremely grateful for it. I think the dorms are better than average and the beds are very comfortable - the South 40 is a really great place to live. Overall, I would highly recommend WashU to any prospective student looking for an enriching academic environment with a high quality of living.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I am thankful for my undergraduate experience at Washington University in St. Louis. The college has great connections for post-grad opportunities in multiple fields - business, medicine, research, engineering. I was easily able to switch between the Arts & Sciences program and the Business School at the end of my sophomore year. There is a huge focus on medicine, so even for other career paths there are healthcare adjacent offerings (e.g. Healthcare Management, Bio Medical Engineering, Global Health, Psychology/Neuroscience/Philosophy). The brand name and resources do carry for other non-health related professions too. The classwork can be tough so it's best you find out which paths are a good fit for you in terms of academic rigor, class size, and teaching style. Your counselors can help with this. 

Good size of the school - not too big to get lost, but not too small to know everyone and the campus is very very beautiful! I suggest visiting and talking to alum to learn more!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Wash U has incredible professors, connections, events, and basically everything related to being a high-performing academic institution. It lacks in providing adequate financial support, addressing issues of mental health through paying peer counselors and providing enough services, and addressing oppressive structures that it benefits from, such as Greek Life and investing in Fossil Fuels.
Although there are distribution requirements, non-humanities students can graduate without taking any course related to social/political issues that plague our society, so it can also feel very isolating when surrounded by students who are just grinding to get into med school or consulting. Similarly, as a gentrifying entity, Wash U must do a better job of getting students into the St. Louis community. Most Wash U students only enter the city to go to Wash U-funded clubs, there isn't good enough transportation to consistently volunteer somewhere, and St. Louis events are not promoted enough.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: If you want a school that actually values your physical or mental health, don’t go here. They don’t give a crap if they push students to literally ignore signs of illness or mental health issues in order to do some stupid exam. They’d rather a student show up to an exam throwing up then scheduling an opportunity to retake it when they’re better. Health should be a priority, but here it is the last thing they care about.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love my school so much! The people and community are really what make it welcoming, special, and enjoyable. The memory foam beds are lovely, and my professors are all very nice. I love the flexibility to study across multiple disciplines and schools.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is an incredible school! I am amazed everyday by the strong work ethic that all students here display, it serves as motivation for me as well. Professors are typically caring and accessible to their students, ensuring that everyone gets the most out of their time and education. Resources are plentiful all over campus and there are definitely a wide range of organizations and student groups to help every individual obtain a sense of belonging. Additionally, campus itself is beautiful, there are various dining options, dorms are spacious and mattresses are extremely comfortable. I would strongly recommend visiting the school if possible!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU's environment is very inclusive and accepting. Everyone is motivated to do well while still having a busy social life. This university is a perfect balance between work and play. WashU sets students up for success and pushes students to excel in all areas of life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Shockingly expensive. Dull party scene. Political Science professors biased to the limit of being completely unprofessional. Boring city. Boring neighborhood (nothing to do after 9pm). Mind-bogglingly wealthy, pretentious, and out of touch student body. Nice campus though.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really like the amount of resources I can find at my college especially the Career and the Writing Centers, which have helped me receive internships and help on college writing assignments. I appreciate the professors’ openness to accepting us undergraduate students to get involved in their research.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
WashU is a great school academically and will have no problem challenging your limits in most major programs and courses. That being said, students still have the freedom to push themselves as hard as they feel prepared to; one can choose to get by with 12 units or 21. As a pre-med, WashU's resources also helped me prepare a very competitive profile when I applied to MD-PhD programs owing to the research, shadowing, and volunteering opportunities both on the Danforth Campus and WUSM.

Student life is not super high-energy, but still active. Most students I acquainted myself with were approachable and highly talented.

The area around WashU and the medical school is affluent and there were few safety concerns when I attended. Forest Park and the Sumers Rec Center provide both indoor and outdoor spaces for people to stay active. Dining is relatively high quality and the school housing options are comfortable to live in.

Overall, I'd spend my college years here again without hesitation!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU has a really great community for a smaller big-city university. There's great food options within a 2 mile radius of campus, the undergraduate professors are extremely welcoming and helpful, and the clubs are all really fun! I've sincerely enjoyed my time here, and campus is beautiful in every season.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Really enjoy my time at washu. lots of work and more fun! Food has gone down in quality though. St louis is a decent place but not the best, fun things to do. School does good job in offering many interesting courses and providing some valuable skills
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: BEST. SCHOOL. EVER. Cannot possibly say enough good things about WashU. The people are intellectually driven and supportive, the campus itself is almost inconceivably beautiful (I have never seen more manicured landscaping or such depression-squashing flowers), St. Louis is a city that you will learn to love, and the school excels at catering to everyone's needs. You will never feel left behind. Live, love, WashU.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I consider myself extremely fortunate to have selected WU for STEM. I came in trying to decide Bio/Chem/EPS/etc, but take Chem 111 and you will not regret it. The instructors are amazing, and they go way past the textbook material. I just love how they taught us how to learn. I use brick/wall/house learning in all of my courses now. It convinced me to purse Chem for a PhD, and I know I am ready.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university itself is so professional and a great environment. Working for the university is even better with their benefits.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: An incredible school that will set you up for success, surround you by faculty and peers who care about your well-being, and broaden your interests
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a great school academic wise, with a great atmosphere and student life. I would like to see the food/dining situation improved, as there is a whole student run instagram account dedicated to showing the poor food quality.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: school's good. teachers good. admin responses are slow. campus is beautiful but the city is known to be dangerous.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at Washington University in Saint Louis has been some of the best years of my life. I could not have asked for a better experience!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: St. Louis was a great city to go to college in. WashU provided a great academic environment to learn by bringing together great students and professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Being a student at WashU has been a great experience overall, all the people I have met are very kind and the professors are also great. You get the chance to take so many interesting classes, and I would recommend the school to anyone looking to apply for college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: cool! good environment and it makes you want to learn, people higher up are very bad at dealing with mental health tho
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: At Washington University in STL I would like to see more whole school events that promote community within student life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is an extremely competitive yet cooperative setting. While ranked among ivies and other top schools, it is not as cutthroat and a warmer happier environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Overall amazing. The people who go here really belong, and they all are so distinctly WashU students. The best way I can describe them is very nerdy people who still can get down and have a good time. 

If you're pursuing STEM (i.e., biology, chemistry, or engineering), your courses and course load are rigorous, but most students find it rewarding. Most students who attend are pre-med, but there's a wide range of diversity in majors. The school offers multiple resources for all majors to seek help. It's a very collaborative community, and students are comfortable going to office hours and study sessions to ask questions or seek clarification on subjects. 

My only complaint would be the "WashU Bubble" a lot of students fall into, where they tend to stay invested with things on campus and don't go out and support the local St. Louis community. It's easy to get isolated, so students should be wary of that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU has everything a student could ask for: a beautiful campus, amazing dorms, and great professors. But the part of WashU that I love the most has to be all the cool people I’ve met there. Plus, there are so many opportunities for research, networking, clubs, you name it! Come here if you want a great student life as well as rigorous academics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Its a very nice school with amazing teachers. I am proud to be able to attend this prestigious university!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: An outstanding school whose rankings and popularity are drawn down by misconceptions of St. Louis. In fact, the campuses are in excellent locations with shops, nightlife, and recreational activities all within walking distance. The facilities are gorgeous, the food is great and in endless variety, and the administration and faculty are engaged, supportive, and openminded. The students are incredibly smart and driven but also friendly and supportive. If you are looking for a party school and Division I sports look elsewhere. If you're interested in a place where you can have a balanced social life, be a scholar athlete, and form life-long friendships with people who will make a difference then this is your place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the people at WashU. Genuinely the nicest people I’ve ever been around. Everyone is so smart in their own way, but also collaborative and loyal to their friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: When I viewed the campus I was in awe! So underhyped and love the school soo much ! The students there were so beyond nice and incredible! Amazing school and faculty.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Most beautiful campus. Very loving and welcoming environment! I am so eager to start there in the fall and live in St. Louis with a great new family.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: More diversity of professors and faculty in general. Fossil fuel divestment. The Chancellor prioritizes money over anything else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The overall academics and great balance of student life they offer is amazing. There's a lot of flexibility within a student's schedule itself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is full of really smart, really engaging, and really driven people. Every day I was challenged by my classmates, friends, and peers to be my very best academically, but also professionally, and socially. Some of my fondest memories are staying up all night with my roommates, sometimes having deep debates and sometimes watching silly videos and chatting. My main problem with the school is that I don't think it has a strong enough relationship with Saint Louis. I wish it invested more in ways to retain students within the region instead of letting them slip away to take what they learned at WashU to other cities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Lover the people here, but the administration is upsetting. Also, Chancellor Andrew Martin. What a person.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've been having a great experience at WashU. I'm currently a premed student majoring in Genomics and Computational Biology, and I have found all my professors and advisors to be incredibly supportive and helpful. The food quality has dropped since my freshman year, but it's still very delicious. I would attend WashU again if I had to do it all over again.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very good school for academics--most professors are brilliant in their fields and very available/willing to help. Class sizes are generally small and classes are rigorous but doable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great collaborative atmosphere. Teachers really want to see you succeed, and school has lots of resources to help do so.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's very challenging and rewarding. The professors are very passionate about helping every students to reach their potential. What I like the most is that it's so close to home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Despite COVID, I had a great experience at WashU. I was able to be involved with a wide array of academics and student activities, and the professors really care about the undergraduates.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Exceeded every expectation I had which were all very high to begin with. The school is a great environment that fosters growth and development and is highly inclusive. The school very successfully managed the pandemic enforced restrictions with a keen focus on student physical and mental health care. The school fosters a great environment where students are keenly encouraged to strive for academic and professional excellence.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU and it’s surroundings are beautiful. I find the community to be connected, everyone is there to help. Food is pretty mid. It’s not horrible but it’s not the best.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: To put is as short as possible: WashU is where students go when they want to explore their passions and be successful both in and after their college experience. I recommend students from all backgrounds consider applying to WashU if you have the opportunity.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: excellent academics. the dorms are amazing and the food is edible. lots of resources and opportunities at your disposal here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The atmosphere and look of the school are fantastic; the other students are friendly and amazing; the teachers are willing to work with you and are very engaging; the food is not nearly as good as it's hyped to be—a few meals are good and the rest are terrible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I only looked at this as a prospective student but had family members and friends attend this school so take this with a grain of salt! Unfortunately, it did not fit my specific goals but I had a wonderful experience speaking with the advisor for University College- Elisa Wang. She was the most empathetic and caring admissions advisor that I have ever encountered. If this does fit your needs, I highly recommend!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: High-quality academics. I'm STEM major, nearly all classes are structurally sound, decently organized, and most classes are rich in content. An overwhelming majority of professors I've met genuinely cares about their students and give no hesitation to help. There's less of a sports / party scene here - largely due to administrative decisions. Food quality and quantity has noticeably decreased in 2021. If Princeton keeps giving this school best food I swear to god *redacted*
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Their financial aid is amazing for low-income students! My experience here has been great so far and I’m glad I chose WashU.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU has its good sides and its bad sides. The professors, for the most part, are wonderful. There are a few classes--usually the very large STEM classes--where the structure can be very rigid. But in general, professors put a lot of work into their classes, and are very invested in your learning. The smaller the class, the better the professor (usually). The campus is beautiful, and it's fairly easy to get around. It's probably a 15-20min walk from one end of main-campus to the other. The dorms and housing are pretty good, especially in comparison to some other schools, but it really depends where you end up. Biggest downsides? The workload is hard. The lack of economic and ethnic diversity is very apparent. Financial aid office is usually incompetent. The party scene exists, but its.. um.. I personally have more fun at the club. Last but NOT LEAST: The food has gone DOWNHILL. It's just generally not great tasting. My friend once bit right into a raw chicken tender. Like.. raw raw.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: At WashU, I was truly able to thrive on all fronts. The community built around me enabled me to dive deeply into my many interests, and when I was ready, focus on what I really wanted to do after college. Unlike many other top schools, WashU students are both extremely passionate and serious about their academics, while also being open to working together to everyone’s benefit. At the end of the day, I believe what WashU provides its students is unparalleled, and something I will treasure for the rest of my life. To high school seniors making the difficult decision about what college to choose: WashU should be, without a doubt, at the top of your list.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My perspective is skewed due to the pandemic and not being able to spend as much time on campus but the campus is beautiful. Teachers have been largely challenging and knowledgable in their field. I've made the dean's list and been nominated for scholarships and found opportunities I wasn't aware of, such as certifications in specific fields.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The specialized master programs provided by the business school is poorly organized, and not up to a standard like its US News rank, and they still keep accepting more and more student just for the greed of money. Classes are poorly designed and do not provide skill sets that were up to the current trend in the professional world. Job resources are limited, especially for international students, and the already limited resources are deliberately gave to only MBA students by school's career center. I actually saw from a career a advisor's computer that an employer was looking for both MBA and SMP students for the two openings, but the advisor ended up only posting the jobs on MBA exclusive job board. 

Especially not recommended to international students, because school staffs lack basic knowledge of students' eligibility and limitations granted under F-1 visa. Someone from my class almost got kicked out of country because school forgot to apply CPT for her during her internship.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I went to the Education PhD program here. I can speak to my own experience. While there were really good professors in other programs, the professors and advisers in this program were not the most supportive. My advisers didn't allow me to form a committee for my dissertation proposal before he was completely happy with it. Critical decisions were solely made on his own authoritarian discretion. No much support nor mentoring was given throughout the process. Not the best place to professionally grow and learn. I suggest choosing a liberal program that's better structured and established with more faculty! You will find your PhD life much enjoyable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Faculty isn't the best in terms of building a peer support learning environment. You will also get used to professors delaying responding to your email or even not responding at all. They seem to care about you in class but then they are hard to reach after class.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St. Louis has high quality academics, but that also makes it stressful. Make sure to find a good balance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is a great school for business, premed, engineering programs. The campus and quality of student life are amazing. WashU has a collaborative atmosphere that is not present among many other T20 schools.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved WashU. Such a great experience but the best part was the people that I met. I loved the classes and parties and friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and the community around feels so welcoming and accepting. Classes are difficult, but there are many resources that can help. It also wouldn't such a great school if it wasn't difficult. The food and housing situations are also great. It always feels like there's something to do on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Meeting people during the pandemic was definitely challenging.  However, the people at WashU are of the highest quality.  Every person here is fun-loving and academically curious.  The people here are what make this place rock.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a parent of a sophmore in Visual Arts and Writing programs, I feel so grateful she got in. First of all she got a full ride, they removed a massive strain off of our family and did it completely and thoroughly. She had met and spoken with several faculty members before applying (Early Decision) and visited the campus, and they were so helpful and supportive it really allowed us to make a confident Early Decision. My daughter is gifted, but shy shy shy, and her mother is Brazilian, so VERY attached and we worried about sending her away. It was tough, but the support of programs like Deneb Stars and the many other programs (including late night escorts for safety) allowed her to make the leap and find her feet. Once the pandemic hit, WashU was amongst the first half dozen schools to move online (they are now hybrid, my daughter is working from home). The faculty and admin prioritized their health first, while the coursework has remained rigorous. She is thriving. A+ response Washu!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've only been here for a week and I love it! The professors are great and every student I meet is so nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a biomedical engineering major and premed at WashU, I will say the school is not easy. However, I would fail to come up with an institution that rivals WashU's commitment to holistic and collaborative education. Research opportunities are absolutely incredible to say the least, and you are quite literally, living in a massive mile-wide castle.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a great school with the most amazing campus. Courses are rigorous but extremely interesting. It is a great school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is home to me. I've met the most supportive and amazing people in my life here. I highly recommend for incoming freshman to bond with people on their floor early on - it can be a great community if you try to make it one. The people are down to earth, friendly, and you'll learn a lot simply from the people around you. And though the academics are demanding, the culture is truly collaborative and welcoming. However, it is quite pre-professional focused which I both appreciate and want to change. Try to hang out with a myriad of different people to grow as a person on all fronts.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far, my experience at WashU has been good. I will say that the support from staff and professors has been overall exceptional.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very academically rigorous school. Good for premeds: challenging without being competitive and toxic. However, school culture is sort of what you make of it; very low focus on sports and partying due to high WUPD (police) presence. Lots of cool clubs/extracirriculars to make up for it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is an excellent school and immediately felt like home to me. The academics can definitely be challenging but are manageable. The campus is stunning and there are many different things to get involved in during the semester.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think the school has strong academics and fun social life. Students are very motivated and passionate about their studies. There is not economic or racial diversity and think this is something that needs improvement.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a recent graduate of WashU, I have nothing but positive things to say about my experience! From meeting some of the best people to interacting with some of the most intelligent professors, I learned something new each day. I am proud to be an alum of such an incredible university and have WashU to thank for helping me land my dream job.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My WashU experience has been incredible! The campus became home within minutes of arriving. Academics are #1 always, which can be tough, but there are plenty of extracurricular activities and sports to diversify your lifestyle.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: While the classes are difficult, and sometimes made moreso by the professors, they are very doable. With hard work and being willing to ask for help/take advantage of all of the available resources, student success is the number one priority
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great experience at Washington University in St. Louis. There was a ton of student activities and clubs as well as Greek life to be involved in. Sports wasn't a huge focus of the school and it was a very academic focused school. There was no sense of competition between students and everyone was very supportive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St. Louis offers a very well-rounded academic experience for students.  The campus is beautiful, but it is very separated from the surrounding city, and it is easy to end up living a university "bubble."  I would highly recommend WashU to students studying certain fields, such as medicine or public health, but I would not recommend it to students who are undecided or majoring in fields for which WashU is not specifically renowned.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and the community is also great. Their academic performance is also great as it is one of the top schools in America. The environment is wonderful It's right by Forest park which is one of the best places to bike, run or walk, and it's close to the loop where there is a large variety of restaurants to choose from.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked the classes as well as the professors. The advising needs to be better from my experience they did not really help me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my time at Washington University in St. Louis. I found my home there, and I found my family in the amazing community of people on campus. I had amazing professors, the campus is beautiful, and the courses were challenging but rewarding in the end. There is a lot of work that still needs to be done to improve socioeconomic diversity, divesting from fossil fuels, and supporting graduate student workers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Wonderful school that supports all students.
Great dorms, good food and lots of smart students!!!
There is a wide variety in the courses you can take..Study abroad
programs are amazing.  Teachers take a personal interest in all students
and there is extra help...if you need it. This school has a close community and the campus is diverse.  Highly recommend it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: A WashU education may seem impossible to attain, but the people here are willing and happy to work with you to make it possible for you. I have found such great community through student groups, faith organizations, and academic departments. There is so much support if you are willing to become invested.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience with Washington University has been nothing less than impressive.  The faculty and support staff have been supportive, professional, positive, and extremely encouraging in every aspect.  Classwork is rigorous and demanding, but the returns are great.  The student body forms a diverse campus community and lends itself to an ongoing open dialog.  I am so proud to be affiliated with this institution and I am uncertain how I could enhance or make any recommendations to enhance the existing programs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wash U is a great school. I got accepted into the class of '24 and I'm extremely excited about it. I went to visit the campus in February '19. The campus is absolutely amazing. When I went on a tour of the school my tour guide did a great job of reeling me in. I loved everything about the school. One thing that really stood out to me was the tutoring program they had available for all students. I think this a great thing to have.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washu is a superb institution. The facilities and campus are beautiful and top of the line. The dorm rooms are spacious and designed well. Freshmen have the choice of a modern or traditional dorm (one with or without a personal bathroom) which is a very nice option. The food is also amazing as we are ranked at the top of many best college food lists. I especially love the tator tots!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent university. Beautiful campus and accessible professors - most the professors and administrators are supportive. The students are great, they come from all over the world, they are academically very strong, but the class environment is collaborative and not cut throat. You do not need to work hard though - you will be pushed by some of the classes. Grading is not easy, some classes do curve the grades. However, there are many support services and as mentioned the class environment is generally collaborative and students are very open.  Finally the dorm life for frosh and sophomore on campus is excellent. For upperclassmen there is plenty of university owned housing available right next to campus. The university is very safe it is in a great part of St Louis. You can/should go into the city - it is very interesting and there are ways to get involved if you are so inclined.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University is full of wonderful, smart, and fun people -- professors and students, alike. The campus is incredible and resources are unparalleled.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St.Louis is an excellent environment that is conducive for active learning. The faculty here are supportive of their students regardless of their background and help those who are minority, low-income, and first-generation. There are a lot of opportunities to grow academically and personally.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is amazing! They have stellar academics in addition to committed and friendly students who truly care about the fields that they're going into. I can't wait to see this school continue to earn its reputation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a great school. The atmosphere's always positive, students and faculty alike are always super willing to help and support, and the professors are all sociable, capable in their fields, and clear in lecture and on paper. Clubs here, as abundant and as diverse as they are, find ways to, when possible, work together to at times set up and hold mutiple cross-cultural and cross-disciplined events on campus. Research opportunities, as well as employment for undergraduates both on and off campus, are offered generously and, almost always, will be provided and made available to those who seek to get involved. The food here is great as well; menus both on and off campus are diverse and palatable enough to keep the appetite up and busy year round.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
WashU has a top-notch academic program with excellent professors.  The school has amazing undergraduate classes.  In particular, the Olin business school is outstanding.   The business school allows for a lot of flexibility in humanities electives while providing a solid business foundation.  The business school is a very collaborative environment which is unlike the cut-throat culture in other elite universities. 
However, there are some downsides to WashU.  There is no party scene at WashU anymore.  The university continues to crack down on all social fraternities and sororities, and the administration has a goal of fully eliminating greek life.  The campus food is trash. I have no idea how WashU is highly ranked for campus food.  Also, there is an extreme lack of diversity at WashU.  WashU is ranked #2 in the nation for the least diverse universities in terms of socio-economic status. The quality of life for students is pretty low because the administration hates fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As soon as I walked on campus, I fell in love! WashU has the best layout of a college campus: everything is close to each other and there are no streets interrupting. WashU is also #2 in dorms, and #1 in food.  WashU is perfect: the only thing I would change about it is the cost. Tuition, rooming, and food make it cost around $70,000 a year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a great learning environment that has interesting students committed to academic collaboration and makes it possible to pursue multiple academic interests at once.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: People at WashU are some of the most caring individuals you’ll ever meet. For the most part, if you ask a student about their opinion of/experience at the school, they can tell you that the amazing, down-to-earth people and welcoming, collaborative environment make it so worthwhile. Students love the school And are always looking out for one another.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm currently enrolled in the Masters of Legal Studies Program. I'm thoroughly enjoying this program. WashU offers a number of classes in various legal fields. I've taken courses in tort law, contracts, intellectual property law, legal negotiations, legal writing & legal procedures & court hearings. The Masters program is 100% online. The virtual experience is phenomenal. It's like being in an actual class, but at home. This program is very diverse. Through this program, I've connected with different students from Asia, Europe, Africa and the various parts of the United States. The professors are knowledgeable and professionally accomplished in the legal field. The program is fast paced, intriguing  and fun. You can complete this program in one to two years.  I started in January 2019 and I'm graduating in May 2020. CHOOSE WASHU! The investment is well worth it and WashU is one of the best law schools in the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St Louis has offered me new perspectives and great academics to pursue my career goal. I would love to see the university improving in funding graduate students projects to offer more events to our students and building up experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wash U is amazing! I came to school here having never visited and am so glad I did. The campus and quality of student life is especially good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman
