Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St. Louis has great opportunities for academic research, supportive professors, and a beautiful campus. My one challenge was the culture--low income students and students of color had to work very hard to find community and feel accepted.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are amazing, you have the opportunity for small class sizes, the campus is beautiful, and the dorms are super nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The people here are so incredibly friendly and there are so many academic and personal resources. Amazing facilities as well. Overall just a very happy, peaceful place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: An excellent school with a great student body and highly educated faculty. They treat you like family here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University is very welcoming to incoming freshman and help to make the transition to college life less stressful.  The campus is beautiful and there are endless opportunities to get involved with many organizations and the community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is the best school I could have possibly gone to. The way the professors and administration care about the students, the campus life, and every aspect of the school is unlike anything I ever could have imagined in the world of higher education. While college can sometimes feel like a competitive mess, WashU feels exactly like home to me, and I wouldn't want it any other way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University in St. Louis is an amazing resourceful school. Between the Student Union and Student organizations running events for students, every student is able to explore their unique interests in different industries and activities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is great place for anyone. WashU has the particular aspects of feeling like a college, but it also has the large connections and facilities similar to large state university. There's nothing I would change about WashU after visiting in the summer of 2019.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Just an elite academic setting in every respect. World-class students; most have perfect or near perfect SAT/ACT; maybe grades are a bit lower than Harvard.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is an amazing school full of kind people and staff that truly want you to succeed. There are so many resources to help students in any area, and campus has a friendly atmosphere rather than a competitive one. Campus is so beautiful and dorms are some of the best in the country. South 40 really does feel like a small town!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great place to go to school. The campus is full of serious students who aren’t afraid of having fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stellar academics and that much is true. If I could pick up WASHU and drop into a better city/state it would be truly great. You really can't compete with ivies because no one wants to live in St. Louis. We can't decide if it's the South or Mid West but honestly neither option is attractive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics are tough, a lot of your general freshman classes will be a rude awakening from high school. Too many students obsess over keeping their high school GPA, just let that go. The dorms are rather cheaply done and the food isn't very healthy. I wish there was more to do around campus for non Greeks. Most students don't even venture off campus into the city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Good, academically strong school with many resources for postgrad employment. Financial aid can be a bit rough, but students here are relatively cognizant of how privileged they are and do not exclude others based on socioeconomic status.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Their tours are great and coaches are VERY nice and devoted. There is an excess of school spirit that you can feel as you walk through campus. Their academics are rigorous but prepare you very well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I wouldn't trade my past four years here for the world. For starters, WashU students are phenomenal. It's a competitive atmosphere, but not at all in a "cut-throat" way. For the most part, everyone is pretty well-rounded and it's not hard to find a balance between studying and having a social life. The campus is stunning (especially in the spring), the food is pretty decent, and there is plenty to do around St. Louis. My chief complaint would be the price tag, but in this case I think you're getting what you pay for.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are many academic resources available to students. Professors are great for getting in touch with others for research opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My Freshman year at washU was awesome! Definitely try to be in the business school if you can lol. Greek life was the best decision, WashU greeklife is a lot better than it's made out to be
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school defines that you can not put a price on the education you receive. Every student is driven, focused, and goal oriented, so the competitive environment pushes you just as hard as the professors! The campus is extremely safe and beautiful and the research opportunities you receive are unlike any other!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academics and teachers. Overall very nice students. Lacks in school spirit, athletics, and the administration is tyrannical about shutting down any and all fun
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University has an atmosphere unparalleled to any other University i've visited. Located in a city, WashU has an amazing student atmosphere with support opportunities viewed as ubiquitous by students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
WashU is a decent school if the only thing you care about is academics and can't get into any other school of the same caliber.  The campus and food are nice but are overshadowed by the fact that as a research institution, teachers want to research and not teach for the most part and the school is very expensive.
If you have any interest in a party scene, WashU is not the school for you.  As a member of greek life on campus I can say the school is making it harder to have and go to parties than it was as a non greek-life freshman student.  I'm not sure why WashU has an A- rating on Niche for party scene, I honestly cannot think of a school with a worse party scene.  People I am familiar with at small liberal arts colleges have a much larger party scene than WashU, so if this is any factor in where you apply, don't come here as you will be very disappointed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Despite not yet being well renowned internationally, WashU is a top academic institution which continues to grow and make itself known through remarkable research and overall presence in academia. The campus is amazing, and food and dorms are exceptional.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the campus and the food was amazing! Excellent programs for STEM and a very focused and efficient pre-med track.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: amazing school. of course some things could be better (tuition is ridiculously high, low socioeconomic diversity, administration isn’t the best) but for the most part washu is incredible. the people here are so fun, passionate, and kind. there is always something to do. the dorms and the food are amazing. i couldn’t have chosen a better school!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I graduated from Wash. U. and loved it. It was such a great experience when I was there.  At the time, the only slight issue was the housing/dorms, which where poorly constructed and generic. They have seen been upgraded substantially. The City of Saint Louis was a bit disconnected from Wash. U., even though it was not far. The teachers were great, though.

I graduated from Wash. U. and loved it. It was such a great experience when I was there.  At the time, the only slight issue was the housing/dorms, which where poorly constructed and generic. They have seen been upgraded substantially. The City of Saint Louis was a bit disconnected from Wash. U., even though it was not far. The teachers were great, though.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Washington University provides students with a great education and has very knowledgable teachers on staff. On the downside, the students are very privileged and are technically diverse racially, but not socioeconomically.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU has exceeded expectation. You can always get the support you need and everyone is truly hoping for your success.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the challenging curriculum and the emphasis on in-depth preparation.  The support systems in place are designed to propel students to achieve their highest potential.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is a gem of a university. Beautiful campus (with some of the best dorms in the country!), dynamic student body, smart and interesting profs. The surrounding area offers rich cultural experiences and a vibrant night life. I can't say enough about how much my time here has meant to me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a pretty good school but sometimes it is hard to be here because Wash U has a lot of students who are kids of the top 1%. In other words the school is not very economically diverse.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy the college experience at WashU. It fits all my needs and helps me attain my goals. It pushes me daily to be better and although the rigor of academics is tough, it helps me be ready for my future endeavors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent academic rigor, notable professors, beautiful campus.  The university needs to embrace both sides of political spectrum, not just one. But I love WU.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU is an academically challenging school, but also fosters an incredibly supportive environment. Students are driven, motivated, diverse, and friendly. I love the layout of the campus and the professors are very invested in their students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoy the atmosphere at Washington University, I wanted to find an academically challenging school but without the competitiveness that is common at other schools. Additionally at WashU it is very easy to change majors or even schools within the university which is great for those who are undecided and it allows for easy addition of second majors or minors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great so far, really academically oriented. Being a small school, I found it really easy to get opportunities for research, internships, or anything that a university could provide for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school has a good learning environment. Faculty are knowledgeable and help students build up professional skills to meet their future career requirements. The school also provides ample scholarship to every student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: WashU has a beautiful campus. Not far from the school, there is the Delmar Loop which is a great place filled with food and stores.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Smart and extremely friendly students. Great (and challenging) academics, and a surprisingly satisfying social scene. Amazing campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: On my campus tour, I had an absolute blast. The students were very welcoming, the dorms were huge, and the campus is absolutely beautiful!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far, I've had a very good experience. There are many activities and opportunities for students (perhaps even too many haha). Someone is always willing to help you succeed at WashU.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love WashU. It is the perfect balance of academic rigor and student/campus life and involvement. Though school gets tough, it's easy to find a niche of people who will constantly support you no matter the issue.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: You definitely don't have to do it, but doing it provides a lot more social events. There are still a lot of really fun frat parties non-Green members can easily attend, though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life does not have a huge effect on campus. The majority of students do not decide to rush, so there is not a lot of pressure to join one. If people do decide to rush, the process it not overly difficult. However, the sororities are much easier to get into than the fraternities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Washu is mostly D3 and most people do not pay much attention to sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We have mostly Division 3 sports and people don't really pay that much attention to them
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They are a good way to find a community while doing service and having some fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The teams are close and create good friendships, but teams value academics over sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: 50% of girls rush and like 25% of boys rush.  The most they add to the college are the parties which are pretty fun.  People are pretty neutral towards people who are in Greek but big/little week can get a little annoying if you are around a lot of girls in sororities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Fan support is almost non-existent- no one attends football games- but we have an extremely good women's track and field and women's soccer team.  The current athletics facility is definitely sub-par but there is a fitness center where the freshman/sophomore housing is.  Also the main facility is under construction so we will see how that turns out.  Clubs are even more popular, however.  We have a relatively competitive club Frisbee team but overall on campus acapella is by fat the most popular competative club.  Their concerts have the highest turn out of anything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I see students practicing quite often but I do not attend the games.,
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Ugh. Its not at all diverse and being in MO doesn't help at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is great if you're a part of it! Its a relatively small community. Students not on greek life don't pay much attention to it except for their parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly no one cares about our sports teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am against greek life as an institution, but that's not specific to WashU.  Greek life (and this applies to most schools) is a niche for misogyny and net zero philanthropy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: If you're more interested in participating than watching, WashU is the move
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: A third of the students are greek, but they are all the same. I myself am not in one and have never considered it, but they are the only groups allowed to throw parties on campus. Not that anyone has time to attend them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It is relatively old, but works if you're just trying to work out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not an athlete and I'm not really interested in sports. The facilities are nice to look at though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not many people here care about varsity sports but we have some good teams including basketball and soccer. Games can be fun to go to but it isn't a weekly event people attend.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not in a Fraternity, but from what I have heard, being in a frat or sorority is fun and not that hard to get into, but the rush process is very time consuming.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As a Wash U football player, there aren't many fans that show up to games, but it is a rewarding experience and we will have some of the best facilities in the country with the new athletic center being built.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I've found my involvement in Greek life to be fun and fulfilling without it taking over my entire social life. I have many friends in Greek life and also many outside of it, and value the connections I've made through my chapter just as much as those outside of it. Greek life provides students with a large, supportive community, many opportunities to get involved through leadership and service, and something fun to do on weekends, but it is not hugely definitive of the college experience like it is at larger schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's a D3 school so athletics aren't as big of a deal as they are at state schools, but it allows student athletes to become more of a part of the larger university community as well, and sports are attended to support friends participating more than for the experience of going to a sporting event. The facilities are very nice and available to all students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not particularly in to Greek life, but that's me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports aren't bug but there's nice facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fraternity life tends to be more difficult to become involved in compared to higher acceptance within the sororities. Most people in Greek Life are also highly involved in other areas of campus, so it can be hard to dissociate a positive Greek influence compared to individual contributions. While Greek life is not as big as it may be at state schools, it does have a large influence on campus, especially in the social scene. You can easily have a good time not being Greek here, but you may feel left out at certain times, especially if many of your friends choose Greek life. Only fraternities have houses, though two houses exist for a mixture of Greek women, simply a residential space to encourage a friendly inter-sorority experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity Sports are intensive for athletes but unappreciated by the rest of the school. Intramural sports mostly cater to underclassmen. The facilities are adequate and are currently undergoing construction. When the main gym reopens in Fall 2016, it will likely be one of the best gyms in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Its really awesome if you are in Greek life, but it doesn't really matter if you aren't
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Nobody really cares about athletics
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I cherish the fact that greek life doesn't make or break a student here, as rush was generally relaxed and fun and there isn't an abundance of hazing or weird tradition. I think the parties are fun, the people are great, and you don't lose quality of student or athlete in the system.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am on the varsity swim team, and while I love being apart of the program, I feel we aren't treated as athletes and our funding is very low. We have worse equipment than my high school team did and we pay for nearly everything out of pocket.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: they have very good facilities and i am very happy with them
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am personally not a part of Greek Life, and I do not look at anyone differently nor does anyone look at me differently because I am not a part of it. I feel like a lot of girls are in sororities, and most girls who rush will get a bid since there are no sorority houses so there are no limits to numbers of members in that sense. The fraternities are more limited and exclusive because they do have houses. If the traditional Greek Life is not your thing, there are other co-ed frat opportunities like service frats that are less of a commitment that a typical fraternity (they're more like a club).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: For the average student that does not participate in sports, athletics do not make a great appearance in student life. However, the people who do participate in sports seem to really bond with their teams which is nice. It is nowhere like state schools in the amount of support for the teams, but there are nice facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm currently involved in Greek Life and I love it. However, it can be difficult socially for those who aren't in Greek Life. The sororities on campus are relatively easy to get into, especially when you compare it to a big state school. Fraternities are much more competitive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports do not play a major role on campus. However, there are many varsity athletes on campus and it is not uncommon to gather a group of friends to go and watch a game.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: About 25% of students. Not huge, but definitely present. Doesn't dominate the social scene either.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school itself shows a lot of support for its athletes, but they are more focused on the fact that we are student athletes, emphasis on the student aspect. They want us to succeed academically as well as athletically, which is something I find very important, as I am a student athlete.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the frats and sororities on campus exist solely for partying. It's not quite my scene.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I've heard the teams are okay, but I'm not a huge sports fan so I never really go to any games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Although athletes are not the biggest part of Wash U campus life, there presence is surely recognized. I personally enjoy watching the football games. Though school spirit is not a strong as other schools, we as a class are working on innovative ways in which we can increase the number of attendees to different sporting events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not in it, lot of my friends are
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is very diverse for a private research institution. People are also very accepting and come from backgrounds that are accepting of diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Wash U is a good school (challenging work, academically inclined peers, opportunities, decent food, nice big dorms that don't resemble jail cells) but the party scene isn't very accepting (frats/clubs/sports). Its okay though because the frats on campus aren't necessarily at the top of everyone's list (appealing, if you will). If you're into beer pong, subtle culture appropriation, rhythmless dancing, drunken PDA and mixers, then on campus partying is your thing. If you're anything like me (black and from Chicago), then you'll want to go off campus to concerts and/or neighboring schools for parties (Harris Stowe State University (HBCU), Saint Louis University, UMSL or SIUE). The downside to this is transportation. You'll have to take the Metrobus, Metrolink, uber or taxi unless you have upperclassman friends with cars. Also, parties are usually $5-10 that are hosted by Alphas/Kappas and they usually up-charge if its crowded. Concerts and clubs are typically 18+ but it sucks when its like Bryson Tiller and its 21+. Campus law enforcement and residential life directors/RAs are pretty lenient when it comes to partying. The general rule is to just be chill and avoid unruly people who can't hold their liquor because students party A LOT. St. Louis is dry though...if you think its another midwestern, urban city like Chicago then you're WRONG. Don't be fooled by the pictures in the pamphlets. Moral of the story is to find a group of people who have the same interests as you, which is pretty easy to spot out. I did and we TURNUP.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic complex is actually currently undergoing renovations to improve it. There is also a small gym on the south 40, where most freshman and sophomores live, that has free membership and exercise classes for an additional fee.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: meh, people do it but it's not a big thing here
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not because of the players. There's just not a lot of student involvement/fan support/school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration strikes a perfect balance between being strict and being lenient.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: WashU is a school that seems like it's just completely filled with perfect people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We have an athletic campus, but our varsity sports are pretty irrelevant to student life. Intramurals are great and the gyms are great, though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is incredible at WashU. Mostly everyone who partakes loves it, and there are plenty of people who don't partake. It is a really fun community that a lot of people love being a part of.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think the administrations handles the college experience correctly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: They seem like decent people, and there's no pressure to be or not be in one
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: S'all good, no complaints. Occasionally loud dorm parties get shut down, but thats it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They're super lenient with drinking. They basically say that we are adults so they trust us to act like it. Drugs though are taken very seriously and you can easily get kicked out for that kind of thing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everybody is super nice! But obviously when you go to a school of our rigor, you won't find as many attractive students as you would at a state school. But the athletes are usually pretty cute. Definitely a work hard-play hard atmosphere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports aren't huge in general, but if you're on a varsity team you still work really hard and students do go to the games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The alcohol policy? Don't drink alone, and try not to drink straight hard liquor. And don't have kegs. Other than that, you're free to do as you wish. The drug policy is much stricter, I believe. As for creating new student organizations, it's quite a hassle. You've got to have pretty much all the details ironed out and a group of people who already want to join your club before you can even become a sponsored club--aka get funded. Protest-wise, WashU is pretty lax. They try to teach you to stand up for what you believe in, so shutting down protests would be hypocritical of them. So they let you protest, as long as you're not stupid about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: In terms of the looks there's a wide range. The majority are not classic gorgeous, but come in all sorts of different types of attractive that will appeal to different people. The stereotype of a nerdy school like WashU is awkward weird looking kids who can't hang, but that's just not true. There are jocks, artsy kids, all american types, preppies and hipsters, etc. A play hard/work hard attitude prevails and everyone is friendly. This is the midwest. Whatever you're into you'll be able to find, and both a dating scene and a strong casual hookup culture exist.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: In recent years the popularity of greek life has made a huge comeback. Participation is up to somewhere from 40-45% in 2015 with good reason. Getting involved is a great way to meet a ton of people, find a smaller community within the school, and access resources. Sororities and fraternities have strong support systems for their members in all different areas, academic social or other. They also build mentor type relationships between freshmen and upperclassmen that are awesome to have. At the same time being greek is just a lot of fun and opens up a ton of social events to members while still being pretty low key. Sororities don't have houses at all and most of the guys don't actually live in the frat houses, it's not a huge commitment and definitely doesn't eclipse people's other friend groups.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A good mix of community and socializing, with an emphasis on philanthropy and the greater St. Louis community. Not too much of a time commitment that you can't do other things. Also doesn't dominate social culture. If you're GDI you can still have fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Administration treats students as adults if they act like it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Doing the best that they can.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity athletics are pretty much ignored by anyone who isn't a varsity athlete, but club and intramural sports have large participation and are very popular.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school is very lenient on alcohol use and allows students to make their own choices provided they're being safe and not negatively affecting others. Weed is prevalent as well but is treated much differently by the administration and being caught with it is considered a serious offense. Other drugs can be found easily as well by those looking but are obviously not tolerated by the administration.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are fraternity houses, but no sorority houses. The fraternity houses frequently host parties. Sororities don't do too much on campus, although it is a good way to meet new people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The alcohol policy is relatively lenient; there is an "open door policy," in that a small amount of alcohol may be drank within a dorm if the door is open and it is not too loud. Of course, this is rarely practiced, but usually it's ok, depending on how strict the RA is.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The overall student body is relatively athletic, in that the gym facilities are consistently busy. However, most students do not pay attention to varsity sports. Our sports are D3, and although in some cases we are quite good in our division (such as the male and female basketball teams), there is not a strong fan base for any of the school's sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Wash U is very fair and cares a lot about the lives of its students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is pretty low key at Wash U- it doesnt define you, but it is a great way to make friends that last a lifetime and get invited to dances and parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Not many people care about the athletics- I mean, we are division 3. People (especially your freshman year) will go to support their athletic friends!
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: depends on where you look. Cute guys are in the b school and not so much in architecture or engineering
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: It's there if you're interested, but not an overwhelming part of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Nicest and best people I have ever met
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Team here are usually pretty good and a lot of athletes do well and have fun. However, the culture is not focused on athletics. So if you are looking for a "sports school" this may not be the place for you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have no complaints about the Administration and many people love them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: With 7,000 undergrads you're going to see a lot of diversity in looks, interests, social life, and relationships. Many students date, but there is also an active hookup culture. It is fairly easy to balance a social life with your school work. Students dress the way they want to - some in sweats and some in jeans and a blouse. I think Wash U has it's fair share of attractive students just like any other large university would.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: If you're looking for a school where the athletic games on the weekends are the place to be then Wash U is not the school for you. Students rarely attend football or basketball games but there is enough to do otherwise that most students don't feel like they're missing out on anything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The administration and so all in authority treat all students as responsible adults. That means we can drink even when we're underaged as long as we're responsible. The administration in that regard is very lenient - until you overstep your limits and are irresponsible or break an honor code in which case the school will crack down. This policy seems to work well on campus and keeps the students safe.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Good athletics, but at a lower division.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Very few student attend athletic games, but more people have been going recently.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I have not yet rushed but I plan to in the spring. The Greek life here has a balanced reputation of being known for having a good social life, while still also being very involved in the community on and off campus. On-campus housing is only available for fraternities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Guys and girls here are great. You know everyone is here for the same reasons and is willing to work hard for what they want and value their education, but at the same time they know how to have a good time and relax. As far as relationships, it is very much a hook-up based culture, with not as many serious, exclusive relationships.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletic facilities are very nice and a new athletic center is currently under construction. Sporting events are not always very well attended but those who do attend are very spirited.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The general policy is, "we will treat you like adults unless you show us otherwise"
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Supportive environment but doesn't dominate campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Great for socializing, but you don't have to join to have a social life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not many people attend varsity games. There's not too much school sprit for sports. The facilities are decent but not at the level of a D1 school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Quite liberal, very supportive academically and socially.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not the best, but pretty good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Alcohol policies very lax, other drugs much stricter
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our sports teams are good to great but generally not noticed by the student community
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If you want athletics do not come here. The students do not really care about them. The facilities are older, but a new large facility is opening in 2016. Many students are fit and do club sports, intramurals, or work out, but high level athletics are not a big deal here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All of the administration is very kind and caring. My adviser is always willing to meet with me about any concerns I may have. They are very lenient about alcohol but do not allow smoking or any hard drugs. Floors are coed and you can freely go anywhere you want in the dorm. The administration listens very closely to what students say are always there to help.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know much about Greek life. Some people seem to enjoy it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: No one i know goes to games, but a fare number of people participate in athletics, but its not a thing that people focus on. Its more for fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Most kids on campus are at least a part of some kind of intramural or club sport, if not a varsity player. However, sport attendance is low and definitely doesn't dominate the campus vibe. Most people seem to be interested in maintaining fitness, but not cultivating the "rah-rah!" spirit many state schools do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If what you're hoping to get out of your college experience consists solely of attractive hook ups, then you'll likely be disappointed here. Students aren't BAD looking by any means. However, if you're looking for a wild college ride, you'll likely find that WashU's academics will make that lifestyle difficult to maintain if you also intend to pass your classes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: My school is pretty good about being strict when they need to be, like academic honor codes and such, but they usually let us have our fun--college kids are college kids, regardless of what they tell us.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not a huge part of campus, though many people choose to go Greek. Most of the time, the non-Greeks only pay attention to the Greeks if there is an event, a party, or a public pledge process.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our school is Division 3, so not many people are at the school for athletics anyways. We are still rather good, but people are more likely to be studying during a game rather than attending the game.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of diversity in opinions and beliefs, but its still pretty predominantly white and upper class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek housing is on campus and is kept pretty nice. It's not a huge part of campus life but its still a good way to meet people and get involved in the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: WashU isn't a huge athletic school, but there are plenty of intramural sports and great tennis courts.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Alcohol policy is less strict which is good for parties and helps students feel more comfortable seeking help if something goes wrong. Academic honesty policy is very strict which I think is a positive thing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most people are really nice and genuine. Good looking but more on the hipster side.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Students are very accepting, but there's still not a lot of diversity at Wash U. Specifically, there's not nearly enough latino representation. There is also isolation between students, especially international students. Then again, that's probably because they feel more comfortable interacting with students from their same country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is in no way overwhelming. The biggest greek event is Thurtene carnival, and even that is pretty heavily regulated. I'm in a sorority and love it - the parties are fun, the girls are great, the resources are really helpful, and it's made my time at wash u more enjoyable. But it's not for everyone and that's okay - you don't need to be greek to have a social life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Some of the varsity teams are really top notch, however, WashU students generally are not athletically inclined as compared to most universities. Students here are heavily focused on academics, or other extracurriculars such as acapella
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Rather homogeneous with respect to economic status
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The campus grounds are beautiful and well maintained, the surrounding community is full of great restaurants and fun atmospheres. The school is highly ranked and the faculty are well prepared to foster the best learning environments. I am glad I ended up picking WashU!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Campus economic and religious diversity are the mos homogeneous now, but there are multiple groups and university-run boards on campus that are in active dialogue with students about how to have a more representative campus of all minorities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There may not be a strong culture of relationships on this campus. I attribute that to very rigorous coursework that forces students to focus on themselves as well as very social students that like to interact with many as opposed to just one or a few in serious relationships.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not in Greek Life.  What do you want from me??
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Law of Large Numbers aside, the men and women are fairly attractive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The most important facet of WashU diversity I think is that lack of it economically.  Poorer students certainly exist and they can enjoy themselves here, but the lack of diversity is something that is both a fact and something noted by the students.  The major minorities here are probably Jewish, African American, and Chinese (in particular a number of South Koreans)
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The teams themselves are great and intramurals are enjoyable.  Many are more about getting an opportunity to play the sport than playing competitively.  Attendance at sports events is small.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: most guys and girls are well dressed and groomed
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Policies are pretty chill in general
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We are a need-aware school so there isn't a lot of socioeconomic diversity
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I wish our varsity teams had more support
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I've always felt free to do what I want to, they treat us like adults.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I think the campus regulates the most important things
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: WUSTL is very liberal, and there are a lot of international students. there are not, however, many latino/latina students, and there is a very affluent student body.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Guys and Girls are very good looking here at WashU! We have many brilliant minds and beautiful people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Campus strictness is great. The school is extremely lenient, making the students autonomous.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is awesome here!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not in Greek life but I don't feel excluded or anything. However recently there have been some problems with them, like hazing and harassment. But overall I just know them for their big parties and occasional volunteer activities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: WashU students are more focused on academics than sports. However WashU's sports are comparatively pretty good in Division III. The AC isn't as nice - it lacks much of the amenities that other colleges have. However it is being renovated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Though not as good as some of the very sports oriented universities. Some sports teams like women basketball and mens tennis seem to show promise.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: WashU is Div III and does very well in athletics!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Campus allows for a lot of freedom. People do not feel stifled by the university. WashU is a very chill and laid back university with BRILLIANT yet HUMBLE students who have a passion to learn.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life has a good reputation at WashU. The Greeks are not rude and inconsiderate towards non-Greeks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is awesome at WUSTL. Many parties throughout the year and fun things to do!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is not too strict. In fact, the campus is very, very lenient.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics at WUSTL are great!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Many hot girls and hot guys on campus. Seriously. When I toured other top 20 schools the crowds were not that great looking compared to those of Washington University in St. Louis.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus allows for a lot of freedom amongst the students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Though athletics do not dominate the social scene (which is a good thing), Washington University in St. Louis's sports teams are phenomenal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is extremely diverse. Students hail from all around the country as well as the world to attend Washington University in St. Louis.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek Life is great here. About 25% of undergrads participate. The parties are open to all students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Amazing looking crowd here at WashU. In my honest opinion, we have so many beautiful people here on campus. Most people are generally fit and good looking, though of course at any institution there are exceptions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is great here on campus. About 25% of guys and 25% of girls participate so it is not overbearing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Amazing underrated athletics at WUSTL.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse crowd at WashU!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Campus Strictness is not a problem here. The administration is very kind to its students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't think the diversity at WashU is as bad as some people think it is. We probably have the least diversity in socio- economic status.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It really depends on what you're talking about. They don't care about things like underage drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Girls and guys are very good looking at WashU. One of the first things I noticed when taking a tour at WUSTL.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: WashU, contrary to popular belief, has a very strong athletic program. The basketball team is superb!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: WashU treats you like an adult. The administration believes in the student and believes that the student will make positive choices.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is Greek life on campus and the parties are very fun on the weekends!! Tons of people party and know how to have a good time!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The diversity on campus is unbelievable! The types of people you meet is amazing!!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Had more black people than I thought it would; it was a pleasant surprise.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Wouldn't hurt to have a black frat or sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm don't really pay attention to the athletics at my school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek life is a big part of campus. People who join are dedicated and love the atmosphere. If you don't want to join, you are not treated differently because everybody is friendly. There is fraternity housing, but sororities do not have their own houses.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Great looking people at WashU. Surprisingly good looking compared to other top 15 universities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: WashU, also known as Wash-Jew, has a large Jewish population. I am a non-Jew Caucasian male. I do not feel any pressure for not being Jewish at WashU.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: We have extremely strong Div III teams. Some of the best in the country. WashU is primarily known for its academics as well as social scene, not so much for its sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Campus is very lenient. Visitors can float through just so long as you let the resident adviser know beforehand. That's not to say that any random person can show up and bum a room. The administration is reasonable and treat you as an adult from the beginning. They will step in if the situation demands it however.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The ethnic and racial diversity is definitely there, but as always it's up to you to branch out of your usual friend groups and meet someone new.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Relationships, like college, are what you make of them. The campus is relatively tame and the dating scene is there - you just have to make a slight effort to find it and make it work. I've heard that it's a great place to get an MRS degree, but I have no idea what those people were talking about. In terms of relationships, WashU is just another stop on a long road.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a large amount of diversity on our campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think that it is important to have a sense of the Greek life on campus and I am glad we have a good one.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am an athlete at WashU and love being a part of it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are a lot of attractive guys at our school that play sports or are in fraternities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There was always talk (discussions, town hall meetings, and Student Life newspaper articles) concerning school diversity: ways to increase it, make it more visible, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Where fines are involved the administration is very strict. Food theft in the last month has become the administration's new target; students without wristbands who eat so much as a muffin during brunch-time have been dragged down to the campus police station, interrogated, and fined up to $200. It's also common for RAs to fine students $50 every time quiet hours are broken during reading week. Wash U is extremely passionate about honesty and strives to prevent any sort of plagiarism. On the other hand, situations like underage drinking in the dorms are very loosely regulated by RAs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone on campus is friendly. It's basically an unofficial rule in the admissions process. Relationships are rampant, and students are pretty open when it comes to dating and hooking up. Girls love to dress up. Guys love to use any chance there is to hang out and have fun. On average people are pretty attractive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is strict about drug use but understanding about alcohol use. It knows that students will drink and they do not prevent it. However, they do enact rules to make sure students are as safe and responsible as possible when drinking. Noise violations are very important to the administration because they want students to have the greatest comfort when studying or sleeping. Lastly, attendance is important to the school and they show this by lowering your grade with each unexcused absence.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is relatively easy for students to participate in intramural sports or try out for club teams. However, sports are not an integral part of the campus life because academics are more important.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Only the fraternities have houses and the sororities are assigned meeting rooms. This makes the Greek life more low-key and less important, especially to those who are not participating. Rush is in the spring for freshmen which allows them to make friends before joining a frat or sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: WashU has the belief that students should be treated as adults until they prove they cannot make healthy, safe decisions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life on campus perpetuates the rape culture by giving only fraternities access to private houses. Sororities are only given one-room suites to hold meetings in. The frat parties are generally the only parties with alcohol that freshman and sophomores have access to, so there are a lot of individuals who have never had alcohol before being taken advantage of. And the university does a terrible job at monitoring what occurs in the frat houses so it is very easy for women to be brought up to the brother's rooms while they are drunk and unable to consent to sex.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports games are not always well attended by students, but people do get excited about the results after the game.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most people on campus are very polite, outgoing, and willing to get to know people. Overall, everyone is very friendly and there are very few instances of rudeness and offense.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Campus rules and "strictness" are very clearly in place only to encourage safe and mature behavior in students, not to "ruin" fun and parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: lots awareness and respect for diversity
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Almost all the fraternity houses are actually campus-owned.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have really gotten close with almost everyone on my floor.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Great place - you meet all kinds of people here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I honestly do now know much about Greek Life at Brown School and Washington University. I have not even seen much information about the Greek system at all. I'm sure the Greek life is more geared towards undergraduates.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: In my undergrad, I played volleyball for my school, Greenville College. We were a very good team, but ALWAYS got beat by Washington University, who has won the national championships for D3 many times. The gym is really nice!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's division 3, but if you want to be a sports fan and root for the team, you totally can. However, you'll be way outside of the "norm". Pretty much athletes and their friends are the only ones who care about sports. If you're not one or the other, you won't care about athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Wash U overall is a very accepting community with a few exceptional cases. There are many different student groups on campus that are ethnically, politically, and religiously diverse. The school is also accepting of people in the LGBT community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Simply put, the school's policies are reasonable and the enforcement is completely understandable.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not for me; however, WashU's Greek life is not overbearing at all and I appreciate that. They throw parties and host events, but don't dominate social life on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The diversity at WUSTL isn't really as prevalent as school brochures would have you believe. While you will find students from every walk of life (this goes for ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, and political leaning), it's clear from spending even a few days walking around campus that upper-middle and upper-class white people are by far the most represented group on campus. If you look enough you'll certainly run into all kinds of people, but it's very apparent who the largest demographic is at this school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is viewed as being cliquey and is only known for the parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not quite sure how this grading scale works, but I'm assuming it is in terms of strictness (a higher letter grade correlating with a higher level of strictness). There's such a thing as the "open-door policy" here, where as long as you are not causing any disturbances, responsible alcohol use will go unchecked (unless you are on a substance-free housing level, in which case this is a major infraction). Students are treated like adults who have the ability to make their own decisions, and they also have the EST who will respond to any incidents of alcohol poisoning or worse without police involvement.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: This school has many sports, but unfortunately, we're a Division III school that seems to place our focus on academics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Wash U has a very progressive alcohol policy. They treat us like 'adults' and basically allow us to drink and have alcohol, as long as we don't bring it into public spaces (ie. open containers in common rooms or on campus). However, their drug policy is very, very strict. Recently a couple of fraternities have suffered from administrative punishment. Even marijuana is considered a major infraction and can lead to serious consequences if caught more than once.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity is something Wash U likes to boast it has and it certainly seems so at first impression. There are many students from abroad as well as students from all across the country. Interestingly enough, St. Louis natives seem to comprise a very small portion of the student body. Ethnic diversity is definitely a presence on campus, although Blacks and Hispanics are still a minority. What Wash U lacks in diversity is most noticeably socioeconomic. Many students here are from upper-middle and high-class backgrounds, and some of them barely even realize it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: In the evening classes, you have a mix of adults and typical college age students. Everyone dresses well, has something to contribute to the class, is considerate of other students and is encouraged to actively participate in the classes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fans usually only show up at basketball games because there is a fairly decent team that typically making it to the playoffs. The facilities are great and fully equipped. Would get an A+ if there was just more school spirit at the other sporting events.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: (through the eyes of a guy) Pretty much whatever group youre looking for here they have. if youre a bro, youll find some bros. if youre looking for potheads, they got em. Stay in type? plenty of them for sure. When it comes to the ladies, the good looking ones are rather spaced out, but theyre here
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most everybody at WashU is fit, skinny, and healthy thanks to athletics, the gyms, and healthy diets. You can find a lot of attractive guys and girls, but there also are a lot of not-so-hot people as well. If you're Jewish, you're basically guaranteed to find your soulmate here, but if you're not, there's plenty of others too!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life exists but is not prominent. There are frat parties just about every weekend, but sororities aren't as big of a deal. There are popular community service opportunities in greek life, so partying is balanced with productivity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: While there may be a range of different ethnicities and religions represented on campus, whites, Asians, and Jews dominate the demographics. As a result of admissions policies that are not need blind, there is next to no socio-economic diversity present.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very tolerant of underage drinking and partying as long as you are responsible with your self and don't cause problems. If you create problems, they are more strict. There is very little tolerance with drugs and cheating.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Generally on any given Friday there will be a couple of frat parties happening. Saturdays are sometimes iffy. When there are parties they're generally nice and generous with their alcohol, though they're by no means crazy parties. Every couple of weeks there's a registered party but they're usually hard to get into if you don't know anyone and tend to be either over-regulated or overcrowded. Other than those the parties tend to get broken up within a couple of hours, but they're still fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Guys are generally fit (you don't see many overweight people) but not that attractive as a whole. WUggles are not a myth; you adapt to the general level of attractiveness pretty quickly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I've noticed some diversity in race and religion but not a whole lot of effort to bring people from different races together. The races are very separated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
If you're into nerdy, Jewish people, WashU is your school. All the guys are skinny and nerdy, but that's kind of what you sign up for when you come to WashU. Good guy-to-girl ratio; a lot of Greek life, but as you'll learn, Greek life at WashU is way different than on other campuses. If you really want to date, you'll undoubtedly find someone.

Also, wow, this survey automatically made me fill out for guys. Girls here are attractive too; again, skinny Jewish types. Just like this survey though, WashU is pretty heteronormative. Gay guys are way more open; all the lesbians are in hiding. You have to go out of your way to attend LGBTQIA events in order to meet queer girls.

CollegeProwler, I am extremely disappointed that you profiled me into rating guys. Shame on you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We have a greek life but they say only 30% of students are involved in it. I personally, had a lot of friends who were involved in greek life and I think that either way it will be fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most people are pretty fit or athletic.  I see very few obese people.  There are some really cute girls and good looking guys, but be prepared for some not so appealing ones too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Games are fun if you go, but so few people go and nobody really pays any attention to them. We're also great in a lot of D3 sports but the athletes never really make the spotlight.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: How They Should Be – The student athletes here really are student athletes in every sense of the word. There are some very good athletes, and they also all get it done in the classroom.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
From a traditional viewpoint, WUSTL is diverse.  There are plenty of activist groups for almost every cause imaginable, and although the school is about 1/3 Jewish and 15% Asian, you don't really think it as you walk through campus and attend class.  There's definitely a good mix of students from a cultural perspective.

Economic background is an interesting one.  Everyone acts well-off, even if they're not.  You can't really tell on the surface who has money and who doesn't, which is good and bad.  Good because it's one less thing to worry about, bad because people tend to hide predjudice under guise of anonymity.  But the biggest diversity issue is...

Politics.  Wash U, like most of academia, is a left-wing cesspool.  I don't say this to make anyone nervous, because I think it's the same at many places, but you will get slandered as a heartless bigot for being a conservative.  Not a lot, but it will happen at least a couple of times.  I think I have met two or three other like-minded students in the 3 years I've been here.  

Even the so-called "College Republicans" are unabashedly liberal.  If you can hold your own in a political argument, there is much, much fun to be had riling up your fellow students, but if you can't back yourself up with facts, though, it's better to keep your mouth shut.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: a unique, enriching experience – Greek life at WashU is very non-stereotypical. Fraternities are small, sororities laid-back, and Greeks and non-Greeks feel virtually no divide on campus. Each individual chapter (of both fraternities and sororities) has its unique personality, so going through recruitment is a great idea even if you're not sure you'll like it - you never know where you'll feel at home. Naturally, being Greek significantly changes your social calendar, both opening it up with parties every weekend and filling it to the brim with chapter meetings, Thurtene, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: diverse atmosphere – WashU possesses an interesting mix of preps and intellectuals, with a sprinkling of every other type of person in between. Both guys and girls are generally good-looking (especially compared with students from similarly academic institutions) and remarkably nice. Casual hookups are pretty common, but as students get older you do see a good amount of steady relationships, too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Just Lenient Enough – The police prefer to look the other way than to get kids in trouble when they're being harmless and have drunk too much. That said, whenever there is a particularly rowdy/disruptive party in dorms, that hasn't been registered, the police will come and break the party up.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Teams Are Community-Based – I don't really know how competitive the teams are, but everyone on the teams seems to have a really good experience in terms of having a community. I don't think people have that much school spirit though, so that means not that many people come to games, or talk about them really.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We Have Sports Here? Athletics are not big here, in spite of the fact that school spirit/pride is really high. I've never been to a football game. You're only likely to go to games for any sport if you have friends on teams who want you to come watch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fun, Athletic – The [social fraction of the] student body tends to be fun-loving, sporty, and in great shape. There are obviously unattractive and attractive people here, but the majority of the people who like to go out at night are attractive and/or make the best of what they've got. People work out a lot, etc..
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not as Mixed as They Wish – While Wash U is very aware of the importance of diversity and are trying to expand that to include their student body. All that aside, Wash U is still a pretty white and asian campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students Are Fine – Girls and guys are about average. Some are good looking while others are not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The presence of greek life is changing a lot at this school. when i chose to come here, it seemed as though it was a work hard, play hard environment, and that greeks had lots of parties and it was a "fun" school for how highly ranked it is. While almost 30% of the students go greek, this year the administration seems to be doing everything they can to make the school less of a fun school and more of a UChicago-type school. A lot of the social scene has now shifted off campus to bars and clubs in st louis, as frats are now extremely limited in the amount of parties they can have and how "rowdy" the parties can be. I don't know why the school wants to ruin all the fun, but before you choose to come here just keep this in mind
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: get out while you can – Greek life is slowly being destroyed. If you care about this, do not come here. The school's goal is to make greek life irrelevant in the next few years.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Wash U has an open drinking policy.  You may drink alcohol in your dorm as long as it isn't hard alcohol, you don't play drinking games, you keep it in your room, you aren't obnoxious, and your door is open.  How much this is enforced depends on your RA, and they're usually pretty lax, except on sub-free floors.
Campus police is also pretty reasonable about drinking, even though students talk about them like they are nuisances.The administration is very strict about other drugs, though.  I wouldn't recommend getting caught with that kind of stuff.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: AMAZING academics. Don't come to WashU if you're not ready to have your ass kicked.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The work is challenging but manageable. There are a lot of resources available to help as well.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm a systems engineer major and it's great. I love the department, and my advisors are super helpful, and the classes are super interesting.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: They make you learn a lot at Washu, but you have so much time to do it because you only have class for a couple hours a day. And everyone is your resource to help you learn and do well.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I applied to be in the College of Arts and Sciences. I will declare my major, PNP (psychology-neuroscience-philosophy) soon. All I really need to do is update my profile on WebSTAC and then make an appointment with the head of this department to go over the requirements.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Our academics are among the best in the world.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: People are SMART and care about what they do. It's impossible to do all the reading, but you'll need to do lots of work you don't need to turn in!
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The professors in my department are amazing.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: No matter the school you are applying to the admissions rate is the exact same. That's because most students change not only their major but also their school while at Wash U (a lot of times from arts and sciences into the business school). Majors are flexible and it is easy to double major. The flexibility of curriculum at Wash U was one of the most appealing aspects for me.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Every summer I have had applicable and highly useful internships. After my freshman year I interned at an asset management firm, after sophomore year I did economic research at a leading industry report writing firm, and after my junior year I had a management consulting internship at a top 10 firm. Additionally on campus I was a microeconomics teaching assistant for many semesters.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The work load is pretty challenging but the environment and the people are very supportive and collaborative.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Getting into the different schools, cross studying between them, or even changing majors or the schools you study in is rather streamlined. The application process is pretty easy, and most students appreciate the way its set up without extra supplements and such. When many apply to many schools at once, ours was a breath of fresh air. A tip would be to show yourself as a well-rounded applicant--it's not all academics, its not all clubs, its not all community service. It's a well balanced blend.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I mean, most everybody in the school is in the School of Arts and Sciences, so it 's not like you are one in a million in your program. Everyone else understands what it's like. But the way the schools are set up, its easy to build bridges between them. Art Sci is also one of the more lenient programs--we choose our own classes and plans of action.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Our school has so many academic resources for the students, and most everyone is willing to help you out if you are struggling in a class--for pre-meds, this tends to be a constant state of being. The professors are all so willing to talk to you and help you understand material. Registration is pretty stream-lined, but sometimes getting into the classes you want, or required classes is tough because they are in high demand and low supply. There are so many places on campus to study: study rooms in the dorms, the 5 floor library, dining areas, even outside if it's nice.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Being a bio major is a tough choice at my school--it's very rigorous and the classes take a lot of work and studying, but it's also very rewarding. There are lots of opportunities for bio majors to participate in research, or get in on tutoring, or get backfiles from other students before them.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great professors and advisors and study abroad programs. Work load is hard, but its worth it.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The law school is great. The students are nice and high achieving which makes you work harder.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Similar to what I said above, the business school professors are really great, and put their students before their research. The facilities available to business students are incredible and there's always free food. Classes can get challenging and grades are curved against one another, so classes can get more competitive than in arts and sciences classes. That being said, Olin is nowhere near as competitive as other top notch business programs. The workload is challenging but very practical and useful for your future career. Go and study in the new business school building, Bauer hall. It's incredible in there.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The business school is more preprofessional than any of the other four schools at Wash U. You start learning how to dress and prepare for interviews the first month or two of class. They have incredible resources available to you, the professors are all intelligent, assessable, and eloquent when it comes to teaching, and you can really tell their teaching comes first, even before research. There's always a ton of free food and Olin just opened their newest building this past January. Though it can get competitive at times and you are sometimes compared with your peers as far as grades go, I have absolutely no worries about landing an incredible, stable job to start at after graduation.
